summary: Email exchange between attorney Daniel Rose and a U.S. Attorney's Office representative regarding a victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The attorney reports ongoing harassment of his client by reporters and media, including receiving a video of Epstein on a YouTube account she didn't know she had. The U.S. Attorney's Office offers FBI victim coordinator resources.

persons.name: Daniel Rose
persons.context: Attorney who sent the email reporting harassment of his client by reporters and media, including receipt of a Jeffrey Epstein video on a YouTube account.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of a video sent to the victim's YouTube account as part of reported harassment.

connections.description: Daniel Rose is representing a victim in the Jeffrey Epstein case, as indicated by his communication with the U.S. Attorney's Office about her harassment.

events.title: Attorney reports harassment of Epstein victim
events.description: Attorney Daniel Rose emails the U.S. Attorney's Office to report that his client, a victim, is receiving harassing text messages from reporters and a video of Jeffrey Epstein was sent to her YouTube account.

events.title: U.S. Attorney's Office offers FBI victim resources
events.description: A representative from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York contacts attorney Daniel Rose to offer the FBI's victim coordinator resources for his client.

keyFacts: An attorney for a Jeffrey Epstein victim reported in July 2019 that his client was being harassed by reporters and media, including receiving a video of Epstein on a YouTube account she didn't know she had.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York had previously offered the FBI's victim coordinator resources to assist the victim.
The email indicates ongoing media attention and harassment toward victims even after Epstein's arrest and during the investigation phase.
